page.title: 19SOCIAL CONCERNS
page.content:
One of the keynotes of a thriving rural community is the way in which its people join together to accomplish projects, or individually take on responsibility for other individuals and tasks.
In 1985, through a house-to-house collection, organised and operated by a comparative few, over Â£165 were raised for Christian Aid Week. This is to be seen within the context of many other appeals to which members of the community respond with equal realism and generosity.
Individual needs are the concern of all. The Neighbourhood Watch scheme, recently introduced to give a greater degree of security to isolated resi- dents of the area, is but one example.
